Package memory

Interface CodeWriter

All Superinterfaces:
RAM
All Known Implementing Classes:
Memory
public interface CodeWriter extends RAM
Extension of the RAM interface providing convenience methods for writing machine code to RAM.
Author:
Alex Mandelias
Implementation Note:
The default implementations assume that there exist an instruction counter and a data counter responsible for writing instructions and data (variables, constants etc.). Specifically:

instructions and the Instruction Counter:

  • are written as 32-bit values
  • are written in consecutive cells with increasing index
  • start at location 0
data and the Data Counter:
  • are written as 32-bit values
  • are written in consecutive cells with decreasing index
  • start at location size() - 1

    • writeInstruction

      default int writeInstruction​(int value)
      Writes the value as an instruction in RAM.
      Parameters:
      value - the instruction
      Returns:
      the address where the instruction was written
      See Also:
      default implementation

      int getDataCounter()

    • setDataCounter

      void setDataCounter​(int address)
      Sets the address where the next data will be written.
      Parameters:
      address - the address

    • list

      default String list()
      Returns a String with the listing of the RAM. The contents of the cells are written as-is, therefore this method can be used for listing code suitable to be read for execution.
      Returns:
      the String

    • listShort

      default String listShort()
      Returns a String with a short listing of the RAM. Consecutive cells containing '0' are all replaced with a single line containing '** ****', therefore this method can't be used for listing code suitable for execution.
      Returns:
      the String
